programme.title: Blue World S4 - "Manta Ray Feeding Frenzy and Sea Snakes of Bird Island"
programme.sub-title: Manta Ray Feeding Frenzy and Sea Snakes of Bird Island
programme.desc: Blue World travels to the Maldives to witness a huge Manta ray feeding frenzy and then visits Indonesia to explore an island surrounded by venomous sea snakes!

programme.title: Blue World S4 - "Bull Sharks and Inner Space at NASA"
programme.sub-title: Bull Sharks and Inner Space at NASA
programme.desc: Blue World travels to Mexico for an up-close encounter with Bull sharks and then visits NASA's Neutral Buoyancy Lab in Houston where astronauts train underwater for space walking.

programme.title: Angry Planet S3 - "Highway to Hell"
programme.desc: George heads straight into the “Bearcage”, looking to get beat up by the biggest, baddest hailstones that Texas and Oklahoma can throw at them. He finds it –and the stormchasing vehicles don’t look too pretty after coming through these massive storms

programme.title: Angry Planet S3 - "Space"
programme.desc: We break the bounds of earth, and look at the environment of space. We examine the difficulties and challenges of exploring this most challenging environment.

programme.title: Wildlife Heroes S1 - "Dr. Betsy Fox"
programme.desc: Originally from the USA, Dr. Betsy Fox has lived in Namibia since 1990 and has led an exciting life ever since amongst its wildlife.

programme.title: Wildlife Heroes S1 - "Dr. Rainer Dolch"
programme.desc: Dr. Rainer Dolch is an ecologist who has been living and researching in Madagascar for almost 30 years.

programme.title: Wildlife Heroes S1 - "Jonathan Franzen"
programme.desc: Jonathan Franzen, the bestselling author and enthusiastic birdwatcher not only familiarizes us with the birdlife, but also discusses the far-reaching consequences of the drastic decline in birds on a global scale and what we can do to save them.

programme.title: Hollywood Weapons: Fact or Fiction? S4 - "The Last Crusade of Indiana Terry"
programme.sub-title: The Last Crusade of Indiana Terry
programme.desc: Terry channels his inner Dr. Jones and tests 1 scene from Indiana Jones and the Last Crusade containing 3 different tests, two of which they will need a tank for. The duo will travel down to Uvalde, TX to visit Drivetanks.com to see if a tank round will topple over a car, and if a 9mm round can travel through three Germans.

programme.title: Hollywood Weapons: Fact or Fiction? S4 - "Equalizing Terry"
programme.desc: Terry and Larry will test 3 scenes from Denzel Washington’s Equalizer films. Can Terry be as cool as Denzel and use propane tanks and a microwave to create an explosion, use a staple gun to take out the bad guy, or create a scenario where a flash bang will ignite a room full of baking flour?

programme.title: Hollywood Weapons: Fact or Fiction? S4 - "Silencing Terry"
programme.desc: Terry wants to demonstrate how Hollywood has used different objects to silence a gunshot, and he and Larry will take to the range to see which one is the most qualified to act as a silencer. Terry also has a sit-down with Joey Zasa from Godfather 3 (Joe Mantegna) to discuss what he thinks of Hollywood’s adaptation of the silencer.

programme.title: Hollywood Weapons: Fact or Fiction? S4 - "Meet the Smiths"
programme.desc: Terry finally gets to compare himself to Brad Pitt!! Terry and Larry test 3 scenes from action film Mr. and Mrs. Smith. Can a refrigerator or elevator door protect our heroes? Also, can you ignite a gas line with just a bullet? Larry may not look as stunning as Angelina Jolie, but he will help Terry find out the answers.

programme.title: Extraordinary Humans S2 - "Anthony Kelly"
programme.desc: Thom’s in the UK to track down Anthony Kelly; a man whose world record breaking reflexes are rumoured to be superhuman.

programme.title: Extraordinary Humans S2 - "George Aldrich"
programme.desc: Thom meets a man with a superhuman sense of smell; George Aldrich is Nasa’s Chief Sniffer; employed to detect problems before they become a hazard in space.

programme.title: Secrets of the Brain S2 - "Empathy"
programme.desc: We meet an individual who has an extraordinary neurological condition, mirror touch synaesthesia, allows them to feel the exact sensation or emotion of another.

programme.title: Secrets of the Brain S2 - "Gut"
programme.desc: Jack meets a poker player who has won millions in high stakes international tournaments using his gut instincts.

programme.title: Secrets of the Brain S2 - "Twins"
programme.desc: Dr Jack Lewis is on a mission to understand why identical twins are such an asset to science from development in the womb onwards.

programme.title: Earthrise S1 - "Healthy Eating"
programme.desc: Earthrise goes to the UK and Chile to explore how we can break our addiction to unsustainable meat and dairy products and eat dishes that are healthy both for people and the planet.

programme.title: Ultimate Processes S1 - "Motor Homes"
programme.desc: Francesca finds out for herself just how good today’s mobile homes can be . She visits one UK company who specialise in producing top of the range vehicles.

programme.title: Ultimate Processes S1 - "Wooden Houses"
programme.desc: Francesca visits two companies making wooden houses. One makes flat pack homes for assembly and the other specialises in creating beautiful wooden frames.

programme.title: Oddly Satisfying Science S1 - "Up and Atom"
programme.desc: This week's experiments blow open the science behind creating a glowing pickle, how forensic teams extract DNA, and how acids can transform simple household items to their core.

programme.title: Oddly Satisfying Science S1 - "Hot Hot Heat"
programme.desc: This week's experiments investigate how to send secret messages with heat, how a little bit of melted candle wax can turn into a bomb, and why heat is an essential ingredient in cooking an egg.

programme.title: Oddly Satisfying Science S1 - "Explosive Elements"
programme.desc: This week's experiments include recreating a big bang with lithium, the incendiary power of methane, and how a little bit of liquified nitrogen can lend a lot of power to a rocket.

programme.title: Oddly Satisfying Science S1 - "Colorful Conundrums"
programme.desc: This week's experiments highlight how electricity can tint titanium, how you can create a color wheel by lighting things on fire, and why the world gets all its colors from white light.

programme.title: The New Frontier S3 - "Juno , Cassini and Beyond"
programme.desc: The Cassini space craft has completed its mission over Saturn, Juno has reached its target and has commenced its scientific observations of the giant planet Jupiter. and New Horizons speeds on it its next encounter at the edge of the solar system.

programme.title: The New Frontier S3 - "Slingshot"
programme.desc: Sending probes throughout the solar system is a mathematician’s dream and an engineer’s nightmare, sling shotting probes around other planets to arrive at their destination, we checkout the latest probes about to slingshot about the solar system.

programme.title: The New Frontier S3 - "Living Planet"
programme.desc: With continuous observation of Earth from orbit scientists have built a data set over time that reveals much about how the Earth breaths and life sustains itself on this living Planet.

programme.title: The New Frontier S3 - "Cosmic collisions"
programme.desc: Cosmic and x rays, these mysterious and highly powerful particles from deep space are being investigated to finally discover where they come from.

programme.title: How Do They Do It S13 - "Duvets/Drill Pipes/Rubber Bands"
programme.desc: How do they make the world’s softest duvets? How do they drill for oil thousands of metres below ground? How do they put the stretch in the world’s stretchiest rubber bands?

programme.title: How Do They Do It S13 - "Aircraft Engines/Fisherman’s Friend/Plastic Bank Notes/Ice Cream"
programme.sub-title: Aircraft Engines/Fisherman’s Friend/Plastic Bank Notes/Ice Cream
programme.desc: How do they build a diesel engine that can fly? How do they make the cough sweet that's been keeping throats clear for 150 years? How do they turn clear plastic into unforgeable bank notes? How do they do the world’s favourite ice cream flavours?

programme.title: How Do They Do It S13 - "Armored Car/Christmas Trees/Cymbals"
programme.desc: How do they turn a family car into a fortress on wheels? How do they grow millions of perfect Christmas Trees? How do they hammer out the world’s best cymbals?

programme.title: How Do They Do It S14 - "Aluminium Cans, Cuckoo Clocks, Paddleboards"
programme.desc: An insight into how used aluminium cans are turned into planes and rockets, and the carving of a traditional Black Forest cuckoo clock.

programme.title: How Do They Do It S14 - "Car Shredder, Sarees, Worcestershire Sauce"
programme.desc: How do they build the ultimate car crushing colossus? Plus, how do Lea and Perrins concoct their Worcestershire sauce?

programme.title: Xploration DIY Sci S6 - "Believe It Or Not"
programme.desc: Host Steve Spangler presents amazing science stunts that your friends will not believe – but they’re real! – from pre-sliced bananas to the way to crush raw eggs without turning them to mushy egg soup.

programme.title: Xploration DIY Sci S6 - "Science In The Kitchen"
programme.desc: Steve Spangler creates science toys, tricks and experiments that you can make using simple things you can find in your kitchen.

programme.title: Xploration DIY Sci S6 - "The DIY Sci Challenge"
programme.desc: One group of fourth grade students faces “The DIY SCI Challenge.” Steve Spangler challenges them to invent a contraption that will keep an egg from breaking when it’s dropped from a ladder.

programme.title: Xploration DIY Sci S6 - "Recycled Science"
programme.desc: Steve Spangler shows you how to take your recycled junk and turn it into the coolest do-it-yourself science.

programme.title: Bright Now S1 - "African Animal Rescue"
programme.desc: The staff of South Africa's Manyoni Private Game Reserve passionately care for some of the world's most exotic and endangered wild animals. From treating elephant foot infections to testing cheetahs for tuberculosis, they never know what to expect.

programme.title: Bright Now S1 - "New Firefighting Tech"
programme.desc: Firefighters have relied on the same basic tools for decades. But former NASA engineer Mike Ralston hopes to change that with a new breed of emergency vehicle.

programme.title: Bright Now S1 - "Modern Stone Age Family"
programme.desc: Food Anthropologist Dr. Bill Schindler is on an international quest to discover what we should eat. Hi and his family uncover ancient culinary practices and show how they can bring simplicity and good health to the modern kitchen.

programme.title: Bright Now S1 - "Capturing Woodstock"
programme.desc: Few films have had a bigger impact on the American psyche than "Woodstock". Producer Dale Bell reeveals what it took to create the revolutionary documentary that captured the definig moment of 1960s counterculture.

programme.title: DRONERS S1 - "Extreme Droners"
programme.desc: Some drone pilots take their ‘quads’ to the extreme, building strange new designs, racing them in epic locations and building alternative communities.

programme.title: DRONERS S1 - "Droners Volcano Mission"
programme.desc: A team of daredevil DRONERS go on an epic mission to an active volcano to try and fly their drones inside a lava pit - all in the name of science.

programme.title: Rethink S1 - "The Magic of Newtonian Fluids"
programme.desc: In a world where nothing is what it seems we’ll explain optical illusions like forced perspective, introduce you to the magic of Newtonian fluids and take an in - depth look at the magic bed of nails trick.

programme.title: Rethink S1 - "Grandfather Paradox and Time Travel"
programme.desc: In a world where nothing is what it seems, let’s explain Ambigram’s and how they trick you plus we’ll discover the Grandfather paradox and the question of time travel. Finally we’ll put your ears to the test with the Shepard Tone illusion.

programme.title: Rethink S1 - "McGurk Effect Phenomenon"
programme.desc: Lets take a look at the art movement photorealism and another test for your ears in the McGurk Effect phenomenon. We’ll take you back in time to introduce you to Peppers ghost and highlight famous forward thinker Leonardo Da Vinci.

programme.title: Xploration Outer Space S3 - "Space Shuttle Documentary"
programme.desc: Host Emily Calandrelli speaks with five astronauts who ventured into space aboard this amazing and complex spacecraft.
